satisfying.definition: bringing pleasure to a person by providing something that person wants or needs
satisfying.example: Billy thinks it is satisfying to drink a big cup of iced tea after he exercises.
satisfying.example_tw: 比利認為運動後喝一大杯冰茶是件很令人滿足的事。

inspire.definition: to cause someone to have the desire, confidence, or enthusiasm to do a good thing or improve himself or herself
inspire.example: The superheroine Wonder Woman has inspired a lot of girls with her bravery and strength.
inspire.example_tw: 女超人神力女超人以她的勇敢和力量激勵了很多女孩。

connect.definition: to develop a relationship with someone
connect.example: The two friends connected with each other when they rode their bikes around the country together.
connect.example_tw: 這兩位朋友一起騎自行車環遊全國時，彼此建立了深厚的關係。

communicate.definition: to share information, facts, ideas, or feelings with others
communicate.example: The Internet allows us to communicate quickly and easily with people all over the world.
communicate.example_tw: 網際網路讓我們可以快速輕鬆地與世界各地的人們溝通。

introduce.definition: to inform or teach someone about something that he or she doesn't know much about
introduce.example: This two-minute video introduces the public to the latest iPhone and its new features.
introduce.example_tw: 這段兩分鐘的影片向大眾介紹了最新的iPhone及其新功能。

throughout.definition: occurring during an entire period of time
throughout.example: In some countries, like Singapore, the weather stays hot throughout the year.
throughout.example_tw: 在一些國家，例如新加坡，天氣全年都很熱。

message.definition: a piece of writing such as an email or SMS (short message service) sent to someone electronically
message.example: Kylie sent a text message to her boss to tell him that she would be ten minutes late for work.
message.example_tw: 凱莉發了一則簡訊給她的老闆，告訴他她上班會遲到十分鐘。

refresh.definition: to click on something to make the latest information appear
refresh.example: Olivia refreshed her Facebook Feed to check for new posts from her friends.
refresh.example_tw: 奧莉維亞刷新了她的臉書動態，查看朋友們是否有新的貼文。

romantic.definition: related to love or a couple's personal relationship
romantic.example: Nicole and Sam were just friends for many years and never developed a romantic relationship.
romantic.example_tw: 妮可和山姆多年來只是朋友，從未發展成戀愛關係。

focus.definition: to pay particular attention to one thing, situation, or person
focus.example: Jason couldn't focus on the action in the movie because he was trying to read the words on the screen.
focus.example_tw: 傑森無法專心看電影的情節，因為他正試圖閱讀螢幕上的字幕。

ignore.definition: to not pay attention to something or someone
ignore.example: Grace totally ignored her younger brother as he made silly faces at her.
ignore.example_tw: 葛瑞絲完全忽略了她弟弟，儘管他對她做鬼臉。

attention.definition: the act of focusing on something or someone
attention.example: The article draws our attention to the importance of being good parents in today's world.
attention.example_tw: 這篇文章提醒我們在今日世界為人父母的重要性。

deny.definition: to refuse to admit that something is true
deny.example: Mr. Lin denied giving a box of candy to his daughter, but Mrs. Lin didn't believe him.
deny.example_tw: 林先生否認給他女兒一盒糖果，但林太太不相信他。

respond.definition: to give a spoken or written reply to someone or something
respond.example: Chris responded to his mom's Facebook message with a smiling cat sticker.
respond.example_tw: 克里斯用一張微笑的貓咪貼圖回應了他媽媽的臉書訊息。

disappointed.definition: sad or upset because something you hoped for has not happened or has not occurred in the way that you expected
disappointed.example: Fiona was really disappointed that her favorite character died at the end of the movie.
disappointed.example_tw: 費歐娜對於她最喜歡的角色在電影結尾死掉感到非常失望。

personally.definition: in a way that is regarded as hurtful to one's self
personally.example: Please don't take my comment personally. I'm complaining about all the drivers in our country, not just you.
personally.example_tw: 請不要把我的評論當成是針對你個人。我是在抱怨我們國家的所有駕駛，不只是你。

wonder.definition: to consider something and try to decide what is true, what will happen, what one should do, and so on
wonder.example: Samuel wonders if he will lose some weight after he joins the swimming club.
wonder.example_tw: 山謬想知道他加入游泳社後會不會瘦一點。

amazing.definition: very surprising, incredible, and hard to believe
amazing.example: It's amazing how bright the stars are outside of the city at night!
amazing.example_tw: 夜晚在市郊的星星是如此明亮，真是令人驚奇！

average.definition: an amount, type, or level that is in the middle
average.example: Helen usually scores above average on her exams because she always studies much harder than her classmates.
average.example_tw: 海倫的考試成績通常在平均之上，因為她總是比同學用功許多。

therefore.definition: as a result of something that was just mentioned
therefore.example: The boots were much more expensive than Tina had expected; therefore, she didn't buy them.
therefore.example_tw: 這雙靴子比蒂娜預期的貴很多；因此，她沒有買。

nap.definition: to sleep for a short period of time during the day
nap.example: Craig has a bad habit of staying up late and then napping several times during the day.
nap.example_tw: 克雷格有熬夜的壞習慣，然後白天會小睡好幾次。

float.definition: to remain on or near the surface of the water or of another liquid and not sink
float.example: Jenna threw a piece of bread into the pond and watched it float until a fish ate it.
float.example_tw: 珍娜把一塊麵包丟進池塘，看著它漂浮著，直到一條魚把它吃掉。

avoid.definition: to prevent something, usually bad, from happening
avoid.example: The family avoided getting stuck in the traffic jam by leaving home very early in the morning.
avoid.example_tw: 這家人為了避免塞車，一大早就出門了。

surface.definition: the top layer of water or land, or the outer layer of something
surface.example: When too many people boarded the little boat, it began to sink below the surface of the water.
surface.example_tw: 當太多人登上小船時，它開始沉入水面下。

breathe.definition: to take air into your lungs and blow it out through your nose or mouth
breathe.example: The yoga teacher told her students to breathe in as they lifted their arms above their heads.
breathe.example_tw: 瑜珈老師告訴學生們，舉起手臂過頭時要吸氣。

awake.definition: not sleeping, no longer sleeping, or not yet asleep
awake.example: The loud music from the neighbors' party kept the whole family awake all night.
awake.example_tw: 鄰居派對的吵雜音樂讓全家人整夜都醒著。

impressive.definition: able to make one feel amazed because something or someone is very good, skillful, etc.
impressive.example: It's so impressive that Brian can say "hello" and "thank you" in more than fifteen languages!
impressive.example_tw: 布萊恩會用超過十五種語言說「你好」和「謝謝」，真是令人印象深刻！

distance.definition: the length of the space between two places or things
distance.example: The distance between the eastern end of Russia and the western one is about ten thousand kilometers.
distance.example_tw: 俄羅斯東端和西端之間的距離大約是一萬公里。

journey.definition: a trip that is usually long in terms of distance or time
journey.example: After high school, the two best friends plan to go on a journey around the world.
journey.example_tw: 高中畢業後，這兩個最好的朋友計劃環遊世界。

flight.definition: the condition, state, or process of flying
flight.example: Baby birds usually take flight for the first time after they are only about two or three weeks old.
flight.example_tw: 幼鳥通常在出生大約兩到三週後才會第一次飛行。

variety.example: That store sells a wide variety of children's toys and books.
variety.example_tw: 那家商店出售各式各樣的兒童玩具和書籍。

creature.definition: a living thing such as an animal, or an imagined being such as a monster
creature.example: Nick is kind-hearted. He wouldn't hurt any living creature, not even a mosquito.
creature.example_tw: 尼克心地善良。他不會傷害任何生物，甚至連一隻蚊子也不會。

expert.definition: a person with advanced knowledge, skills, or training in a particular field or subject
expert.example: Mr. Yang is an expert in math. I'm glad to have him as my tutor.
expert.example_tw: 楊先生是數學專家。我很高興有他當我的家教。

survive.definition: to stay alive or continue to exist
survive.example: Some animals are able to survive from season to season by changing the color of their fur.
survive.example_tw: 有些動物能夠透過改變毛色來度過不同的季節。

sensitive.definition: able to notice very subtle things such as changes or differences that others may not be aware of
sensitive.example: Kelly is very sensitive to flavors. She can taste any food or drink and name it without seeing it.
sensitive.example_tw: 凱莉對味道非常敏感。她可以品嚐任何食物或飲料並在沒有看到的情況下說出它的名字。

keen.definition: highly advanced, referring to the five senses
keen.example: The owl has such a keen sense of hearing that it can hunt animals in the dark.
keen.example_tw: 貓頭鷹有如此敏銳的聽覺，以至於它可以在黑暗中捕獵動物。

detect.definition: to find or be aware of something not easy to notice
detect.example: For most people, it is not easy to detect a small change in temperature.
detect.example_tw: 對大多數人來說，察覺溫度的微小變化並不容易。

item.example: More than half of the items in the clothing store were on sale for one day only.
item.example_tw: 這家服裝店一半以上的商品僅特價一天。

accomplish.definition: to complete a difficult task or reach a goal
accomplish.example: Albert respects those who have accomplished something great in their lives.
accomplish.example_tw: 艾伯特尊敬那些在生活中取得了偉大成就的人。

disease.definition: a human, animal, or plant sickness that is usually caused by an infection
disease.example: Washing your hands often is a good way to stop the spread of disease.
disease.example_tw: 經常洗手是阻止疾病傳播的好方法。

infected.definition: affected by or containing disease-causing bacteria
infected.example: Several passengers were found to have the disease after they took the same flight as an infected person.
infected.example_tw: 幾名乘客在與一名感染者搭乘同一班機後，被發現也感染了該疾病。

locate.definition: to find a certain place, or the position of someone or something
locate.example: These days, most taxi drivers use GPS to locate places they don't know how to drive to.
locate.example_tw: 如今，大多數計程車司機使用GPS來定位他們不知道如何開車去的地方。

reward.definition: something that is given to someone in recognition of a good deed or difficult task he or she has accomplished
reward.example: Janice was given a reward of $2,000 for informing the police of the address of the man they were searching for.
reward.example_tw: 珍妮絲因向警方通報他們正在尋找的男子的地址而獲得了2000美元的獎勵。

ability.definition: the power to do a certain thing or a special thing that one can do
ability.example: Eagles have the ability to fly without landing for over three hours.
ability.example_tw: 老鷹有能力連續飛行超過三個小時不落地。

predict.definition: to guess that something will happen at a future time
predict.example: The weatherperson predicted that it would start raining around 6:00 p.m., and she was correct.
predict.example_tw: 氣象預報員預測下午六點左右會開始下雨，她說對了。

manage.translation: 設法成功做到;能夠應付
manage.definition: to put great effort into doing something and succeed
manage.example: Kyle managed to lose twenty pounds by exercising every day and eating less junk food.
manage.example_tw: 凱爾透過每天運動和少吃垃圾食物，成功減掉了二十磅。

create.definition: to cause something to come to be or to exist
create.example: The inventor of the telephone, Antonio Meucci, created a new way for humans to communicate.
create.example_tw: 電話的發明者安東尼奧·穆奇，創造了一種新的人類溝通方式。

expose.definition: to let someone experience something or to introduce something to someone
expose.example: By reading these articles, students will be exposed to different opinions about the topic.
expose.example_tw: 透過閱讀這些文章，學生將接觸到關於該主題的不同意見。

perform.definition: to carry out an action, task, or duty
perform.example: After Mrs. Checknita fell ill, her family hired someone to help her perform daily tasks.
perform.example_tw: 在Checknita夫人病倒後，她的家人雇人幫助她執行日常任務。

behavior.definition: the way a person or animal acts
behavior.example: Animal behavior can tell us a lot about what a creature is thinking about or wants.
behavior.example_tw: 動物的行為可以告訴我們很多關於一個生物在想什麼或想要什麼。

alert.definition: a warning that there may be some sort of danger or some special problem
alert.example: Everybody was asked to leave the mall due to a bomb alert in one of the stores.
alert.example_tw: 由於其中一家商店發出炸彈警報，所有人都被要求離開購物中心。

complete.example: The race is not complete until every runner from every team crosses the finish line.
complete.example_tw: 直到每隊的每位跑者都越過終點線，比賽才算完成。

assign.definition: to give a special task or role to a certain person
assign.example: Craig was assigned the a tour of the school.
assign.example_tw: 克雷格被指派帶領新生參觀學校的任務。

specific.example: There wasn't any specific reason why Jason didn't attend the performance with his friends. He just didn't feel like it.
specific.example_tw: 傑森沒有和朋友們一起去看表演並沒有任何特定的原因。他只是不想去而已。

plastic.definition: made of a type of material that can be shaped into countless forms
plastic.example: You should never put hot drinking water into plastic bottles or cups.
plastic.example_tw: 你絕不應該將熱的飲用水倒入塑膠瓶或塑膠杯中。

convenience.definition: the condition of being useful, easy, or suitable for people
convenience.example: Many shops post their business hours on their Facebook pages for the convenience of the public.
convenience.example_tw: 許多店家為了方便大眾，會將營業時間公布在他們的臉書專頁上。

eagerly.definition: in a way that shows excitement about something that will soon happen
eagerly.example: Rick is eagerly waiting for his boss to post the summer work schedule because he wants to plan his vacation.
eagerly.example_tw: 瑞克正熱切地等待老闆公布夏季工作排程，因為他想規劃自己的假期。

surround.definition: to be or go totally around something or someone
surround.example: The house is surrounded by tall trees, so nobody can see it from the road.
surround.example_tw: 這棟房子被高大的樹木圍繞，所以從路上看不到它。

drift.definition: to move in a certain direction smoothly and slowly, usually on water or in the air
drift.example: After the captain fell asleep, the ship passed the harbor and then drifted toward the middle of the sea.
drift.example_tw: 船長睡著後，船駛過了港口，然後漂向海中央。

envy.definition: to desire the same qualities, possessions, opportunities, etc. that someone else has
envy.example: Christopher really envies his best friend, Patty, because she has been to so many countries.
envy.example_tw: 克里斯多福真的很羨慕他最好的朋友佩蒂，因為她去過很多國家。

crowded.example: The Smith family is moving into a new house tomorrow, so their living room is crowded with boxes.
crowded.example_tw: 史密斯一家明天要搬進新家，所以他們的客廳裡堆滿了箱子。

obviously.definition: used to indicate that something is very easy to see or understand
obviously.example: The little girl is wearing yellow shoes, a yellow dress, and has painted her nails yellow. Obviously, she likes this color.
obviously.example_tw: 那個小女孩穿著黃色的鞋子、黃色的洋裝，還把指甲塗成黃色。顯然，她喜歡這個顏色。

product.definition: something that is grown or produced, and usually sold
product.example: This shop sells a variety of health and food products for babies.
product.example_tw: 這家店販售各式各樣的嬰兒健康食品。

consume.example: Driving after you consume too much beer or wine can lead to a car crash.
consume.example_tw: 飲用過多啤酒或葡萄酒後駕車可能導致車禍。

poisonous.definition: able to make a person or animal die or become ill if consumed or entering the body
poisonous.example: Chocolate is delicious for most people, but did you know that it can be poisonous to dogs?
poisonous.example_tw: 巧克力對大多數人來說是美味的，但你知道它對狗可能是有毒的嗎？

substance.definition: a kind of solid, liquid, or gas that has certain qualities
substance.example: The police found a chemical substance at the murder scene and are doing tests on it right now.
substance.example_tw: 警方在謀殺現場發現一種化學物質，目前正在對其進行檢測。

recycling.definition: a process of treating used items such as plastic, metal, glass, etc. so that they can be used again
recycling.example: After the party, Nick took all the empty bottles out for recycling.
recycling.example_tw: 派對結束後，尼克把所有空瓶子拿出去回收。

harm.example: The cleaners were careful not to do any harm to the objects in the museum as they cleaned around them.
harm.example_tw: 清潔人員在博物館周圍打掃時，小心翼翼地避免對展品造成任何傷害。

environment.definition: the natural world in which living things exist
environment.example: It is every person's responsibility to save the earth's natural environment for our sons and daughters.
environment.example_tw: 為我們的子孫後代保護地球的自然環境是每個人的責任。

properly.definition: in the correct or most suitable manner
properly.example: Marc didn't complete the assignment properly, so the teacher asked him to do it again.
properly.example_tw: 馬克沒有正確地完成作業，所以老師要求他重做一次。

freedom.definition: the right to do or say what one wants
freedom.example: After Simon turned eighteen, his parents gave him the freedom to watch any movies he wanted to.
freedom.example_tw: 賽門滿十八歲後，他的父母給了他觀看任何他想看電影的自由。

statue.definition: a figure of a person, animal, god, goddess, etc. that is usually made of metal or stone
statue.example: The island of Hainan in China has a 108-meter statue of the goddess Kuanyin.
statue.example_tw: 中國海南島有一座108公尺高的觀音女神像。

remove.definition: to take a thing away from somewhere
remove.example: Jasmine chewed gum to remove the smell of garlic from her breath.
remove.example_tw: 茉莉嚼口香糖以去除嘴裡的大蒜味。

celebration.definition: the act of doing activities for a special day or event
celebration.example: Yvonne invited her friends out for dinner in celebration of finishing all of their exams.
celebration.example_tw: 伊馮邀請她的朋友們外出用餐，以慶祝他們全部考完試。

independence.definition: freedom from being controlled by a person, a country, etc.
independence.example: India achieved independence from the United Kingdom on August 15, 1947.
independence.example_tw: 印度於1947年8月15日脫離英國獨立。

monument.definition: a building, statue, or other large object built to remind us of an important person or event
monument.example: The Taiwan Salt Museum and Qigu Salt Mountain in Tainan are monuments to Taiwan's salt producing past.
monument.example_tw: 台南的台灣鹽博物館和七股鹽山是紀念台灣過去產鹽歷史的紀念碑。

symbolize.example: In Beauty and the Beast, the dying rose symbolizes the Beast's chance of becoming human again.
symbolize.example_tw: 在《美女與野獸》中，垂死的玫瑰象徵著野獸變回人類的機會。

firmly.definition: in a strong way that will prevent something from becoming loose; with a strong will
firmly.example: Jack firmly closed the lid of the jar so that it wouldn't open accidentally.
firmly.example_tw: 傑克牢牢地蓋上罐子的蓋子，以免它意外打開。

represent.definition: to be a symbol of something
represent.example: Sometimes Chinese speakers type '3Q' to represent the words 'thank you' because '3Q' sounds like 'thank you' in Chinese.
represent.example_tw: 有時候中文使用者會打「3Q」來代表「謝謝」，因為「3Q」的發音聽起來像中文的「謝謝」。

ancient.definition: from a period of time in the distant past
ancient.example: The Great Wall was built thousands of years ago to stop ancient China's enemies from invading.
ancient.example_tw: 長城建於數千年前，旨在阻止古代中國的敵人入侵。

slavery.definition: the practice of owning and forcing people to work for no pay or the condition of being owned and forced to work for no pay
slavery.example: This book is about a girl who was sold into slavery and made to work on a farm for years.
slavery.example_tw: 這本書是關於一個被賣為奴隸並被迫在農場工作多年的女孩。

unfair.example: Several players cheated during the game, so everybody agrees that the final score is unfair.
unfair.example_tw: 比賽中有幾名球員作弊，所以大家都認為最終比分不公平。

treatment.definition: the way a person behaves toward or deals with another person or thing
treatment.example: The prison was closed after many reports revealed the poor treatment of prisoners there.
treatment.example_tw: 在許多報告揭露了監獄對囚犯的惡劣待遇後，該監獄被關閉了。

tourist.definition: a person who is traveling to or visiting a place for fun or to learn about it
tourist.example: Mary and John went into the tourist center to ask for information about local hotels.
tourist.example_tw: 瑪麗和約翰進入遊客中心詢問當地飯店的資訊。

attraction.translation: 有吸引力的事物或地點
attraction.definition: a place that people want to see or an activity that people want to do
attraction.example: Beaches and water sports are the main attractions in Kenting.
attraction.example_tw: 沙灘和水上活動是墾丁的主要景點。

landmark.definition: a large natural or man-made thing that makes it easy to know one's location
landmark.example: The Tokyo Tower and the Tokyo Skytree are two of Japan's most famous landmarks.
landmark.example_tw: 東京鐵塔和東京晴空塔是日本最著名的兩個地標。

globe.definition: the world (used especially to emphasize its large size and round shape)
globe.example: Many of David Bowie's fans around the globe posted images or words on Facebook and Instagram in memory of him after he died on January 10, 2016.
globe.example_tw: 2016年1月10日大衛·鮑伊去世後，全球許多粉絲在臉書和Instagram上發布圖片或文字以紀念他。

triumph.example: The soccer team's moment of triumph came when the final goal was scored.
triumph.example_tw: 足球隊的勝利時刻在最後一球進門時到來。

apply.definition: to officially request something, such as a job or a place at a university
apply.example: To apply for the job, Mary had to fill out several forms and send them to the company.
apply.example_tw: 為了申請這份工作，瑪麗必須填寫幾份表格並寄給公司。

instrument.definition: an item whose main use is to make music, such as a guitar or violin
instrument.example: Harry can play several instruments, such as the piano and the trumpet.
instrument.example_tw: 哈利會演奏好幾種樂器，例如鋼琴和小號。

somehow.translation: 以某種方式;不知怎麼地
somehow.definition: in a manner that is not clear or cannot be easily understood
somehow.example: When Gina lost her keys, her dog somehow knew exactly where to find them.
somehow.example_tw: 吉娜弄丟鑰匙時，她的狗不知怎麼地竟然知道在哪裡可以找到。

barely.example: Justin and Kate could barely believe their ears when the doctor told them they were going to have twins.
barely.example_tw: 當醫生告訴賈斯汀和凱特他們即將有雙胞胎時，他們幾乎不敢相信自己的耳朵。

invaluable.example: Eric's grandma has a lot of life experience, so her advice is invaluable to him.
invaluable.example_tw: 艾瑞克的奶奶有很多生活經驗，所以她的建議對他來說非常寶貴。

encouragement.definition: words or actions that make a person feel more confident about doing something
encouragement.example: My mom's encouragement helped me feel less nervous before the school play.
encouragement.example_tw: 媽媽的鼓勵讓我在學校話劇表演前不那麼緊張了。

concert.definition: a musical performance or show given in a public place
concert.example: Tom and Karen went to a classical concert to celebrate one year of marriage.
concert.example_tw: 湯姆和凱倫去聽了一場古典音樂會，慶祝他們結婚一週年。

receive.definition: to be sent or given something
receive.example: Andy received a pair of gloves from his girlfriend as a Christmas gift.
receive.example_tw: 安迪收到女友送的一副手套作為聖誕禮物。

dazzle.definition: to amaze someone with a particularly impressive quality
dazzle.example: During his performance, the guitar player dazzled the audience with his unbelievable skills.
dazzle.example_tw: 表演期間，吉他手以他令人難以置信的技巧讓觀眾讚嘆不已。

potential_n.definition: qualities that could be developed and bring a person success
potential_n.example: With the help of their new coach, the baseball players are able to reach their full potential in games.
potential_n.example_tw: 在新教練的幫助下，棒球員們得以在比賽中發揮全部潛力。

potential_adj.definition: possible but not yet achieved or developed
potential_adj.example: Self-driving cars pose potential dangers, including technical problems and difficulties in understanding road situations.
potential_adj.example_tw: 自動駕駛汽車存在潛在危險，包括技術問題和理解路況的困難。

scream.definition: a loud high cry one makes when he or she is hurt, frightened, excited, etc.
scream.example: The children let out screams of delight during the roller-coaster ride.
scream.example_tw: 孩子們在坐雲霄飛車時發出喜悅的尖叫聲。

dizzy.definition: feeling that you are losing your balance and that everything is spinning around
dizzy.example: When my favorite band announced that they were coming to perform in my hometown, I felt dizzy with excitement.
dizzy.example_tw: 當我最喜歡的樂團宣布要來我的家鄉表演時，我興奮得頭暈目眩。

overseas.definition: in or to a foreign country, usually one across an ocean
overseas.example: After Tina quit her job, she lived overseas in South America for a year to experience life in a different culture.
overseas.example_tw: 蒂娜辭掉工作後，在南美洲的海外生活了一年，體驗不同文化的生活。

determination.definition: the quality that makes someone keep trying to achieve something difficult
determination.example: Kevin showed strong determination to improve his swimming skills by taking lessons every week and practicing hard in his free time.
determination.example_tw: 凱文展現了堅強的決心，每週上課並在空閒時間努力練習，以提高他的游泳技巧。

faith.definition: trust in something or confidence that someone will do something specific
faith.example: Although we were losing at halftime, our teacher had faith in our ability to turn the game around and win.
faith.example_tw: 儘管我們半場時落後，但我們的老師對我們有信心，相信我們能扭轉局勢並獲勝。

pursue.definition: to do something or seek to achieve something, often over a long period
pursue.example: Harriet practices very hard to pursue her goal of becoming a successful dancer.
pursue.example_tw: 哈莉特為了追求成為成功舞者的目標而努力練習。
